intro: Crucianella khorasanica, commonly known as the Persian water plantain, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is a submerged aquatic plant characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. Its leaves are long and ribbon-like, often floating on the water surface. Crucianella khorasanica plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
